oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Organic FETs with HWCVD silicon nitride as a passivation layer and gate dielectric
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: TIWARI, SP
SNINIVAS, P
SHRIRAM, S
KALE, NS
MHAISALKAR, SG
RAO, VR
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: passivation
organic field effect transistor (ofet)
hwcvd
on/off ratio
mobility
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper reports the use of hot-wire chemical vapour deposited (HWCVD) Silicon nitride as a passivation layer for Organic Field Effect Transistors (OFETs). Firstly, the degradation study of the OFETs is done with time. A thin (10-20 nm) layer of silicon nitride is deposited on the OFETs, at a low temperature (<90 degrees C) by HWCVD process, to passivate them from the ambient. Our results show that this technique is very effective in improving the stability of the organic semiconductors (Poly-3-hexyl thiophene (P3HT) is used as a test case in this study). This HWCVD deposited nitride can also be used as a gate dielectric material for the study of OFETs because of its higher dielectric constant and significantly less hydrogen content. (c) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 4th International Conference on Hot-Wire CVD (Cat-CVD) Process,Takayama, JAPAN,OCT 04-08, 2006
